metadata.synopsis: Dialog when the Githyanki in the Knights of the Shield hideout spots the player.
metadata.how_to_trigger: One of the gith, for example S_LOW_Elfsong_Basement_Inquisitor_54467aa9-33dd-41c4-bd77-87a71ed22c16, spots the players.

85.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
85.text: Lae'zel. Glad you could join us.

41.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
41.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz. Glad you could join us, Lae'zel.

117.speaker: Lae'zel
117.text: Stand down! It is on our queen's sacred order that I keep the Prism close.

136.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
136.text: The Undying Queen cares not for who delivers her the Prism and the traitor prince within.

127.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
127.text: All that matters is that it is delivered.

147.speaker: Lae'zel
147.text: Stand down - I protect the Prism on our queen's behalf!

139.speaker: Lae'zel
139.text: This artefact contains the key to our freedom. It is not for the lich queen to take!

124.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
124.text: I know exactly what the Prism contains. The traitor prince who would hand us to ghaik.

22.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
22.text: The false heir's head will make a fine trophy for Vlaakith. As for you -

144.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
144.text: - I will leave nothing behind but meat and shattered bone.

138.speaker: Player
138.text: Strike me and die, a failed warrior forgotten by your people.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: Vlaakith entrusted Lae'zel with the Prism. Interfere, and the queen's sure to punish you.

5.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
5.text: And you, Lae'zel - a child, an unascended - would snatch my glory for herself.

66.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
66.text: You may keep your head. But I will yet be exalted. I will yet see my name carved in slate.

48.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
48.context: NodeContext: Confidently, but not as a battle cry. VLAH-kith-kah SIV-im HRATH KRAHSH-het. Only in Vlaakith may we find light.

89.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
89.text: Damnable whelp. For a thousand years have I given my life to Vlaakith.

70.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
70.text: I will deliver to her the Prince of the Comet. She shall exalt me. The gish will record my great deed in slate!

76.speaker: Player
76.text: I'd give the artefact to you freely, but it isn't possible.

137.speaker: Player
137.text: Orpheus is the githyanki's true prince. You will not take him.

164.speaker: Player
164.text: Orpheus is the githyanki's true prince. You will not take him.

34.speaker: Player
34.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

47.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
47.text: Gith's wretched son will be the fall of the githyanki.

31.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
31.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz.

13.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
13.text: Here you are, as brazen as described.

106.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
106.text: The gloomed soul who thieved from our queen.

154.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
154.text: The gloomed soul who thieved from our queen.

77.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
77.text: The traitor who would steal from our queen.

90.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
90.text: Of course, you had help, didn't you? From the illithid you carry inside the Astral Prism.

97.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
97.text: How quaint that we should meet here - in the very place that it once called home.

145.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
145.text: We know all about the 'Emperor' and its dealings with you. Though I must confess its peculiar relationship with you threw us off course for a while.

156.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
156.text: Most illithids prefer to dominate their thralls through transformation, yet here you stand, only partially transformed.

86.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
86.text: Most illithids prefer to dominate their thralls through transformation, yet here you stand, untransformed.

105.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
105.text: Tell me - what did it offer you in exchange for your servitude?

92.speaker: Player
92.text: How did you know about that?

28.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
28.text: Have you quite forgotten what and who we are, kin?

11.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
11.text: Mind flayers are our quarry. We have filled libraries with our knowledge of how to hunt them down.

14.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
14.text: We tracked it from the moment the Astral Prism fell into its claws.

20.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
20.text: And now that we have found it, we will reclaim the Astral Prism, purge it of the illithid interloper, and restore it to its rightful owner.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: You should know the Emperor is not the only occupant of the Astral Prism.

99.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
99.text: My dear child, I already know all there is to know.

39.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
39.text: I will liberate you from your puppet-master. Ch'mar, zal'a Vlaakith!
39.context: NodeContext: Vlaakith's will above all! shouted as combat rally

121.speaker: Player
121.text: I'd give it to you freely, if the mind flayer would let me.

110.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
110.text: Ha! I see it keeps you on a tight leash. Very good.

56.speaker: Player
56.text: I'd give it to you freely, if it were possible to do so.

122.text: I will remember you said that.

27.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
27.text: I was not asking for it. Htak'a!

88.speaker: Player
88.text: I've fought stronger, faster, and more accomplished warriors than you. You cannot win.

4.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
4.text: Death will be yours and yours alone, ghaik slave. Htak'a!

59.speaker: Player
59.text: I'll send you home in your own box!

98.speaker: Player
98.text: The promise of defeating the elder brain.

148.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
148.text: And you would trust an illithid to do such a thing?

120.speaker: Player
120.text: I serve one far greater than any illithid. We are merely allies.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: There's no servitude - the illithid is my ally.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: My people served the illithid once - never again. We are allies.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: My people answer to none but Gruumsh. We are merely allies.

49.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
49.text: I thought you said this one was smart, W'wargaz?
49.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to W'wargazNodeContext: sneering

114.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
114.text: You have fallen prey to its manipulation.

104.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
104.text: Your story ends here. We will reclaim the Astral Prism, purge it of the illithid interloper, and restore it to our queen.

38.speaker: Player
38.text: I serve none other than the wild tempest that is nature. We are merely allies.

113.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
113.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz. Glad you could join us, Lae'zel.
113.context: CinematicNodeContext: addressed to W'wargaz, then Lae'zel

65.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
65.text: I'm told you carry an artefact most cherished.

75.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
75.text: An artefact our venerable queen would stop at nothing to take back.

102.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
102.text: Tell me, Lae'zel of K'liir. What reward do you think the Astral Prism will fetch once I pluck it from your corpse and present it to Vlaakith?

67.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
67.text: What honours, what riches, will the Undying Queen grant me when I hand her the failed prince?

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Strike me and die, a failed warrior forgotten by your people.

125.speaker: Player
125.text: The queen has entrusted me with the Prism. Interfere, and death will be her reward to you.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: The queen has entrusted me with the Prism. Interfere, and death will be her reward to you.

18.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
18.text: And you - this child, this unascended - would snatch my glory for yourself.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: I'd give the artefact to you freely, but it isn't possible.

91.speaker: Player
91.text: This artefact contains our people's future. I won't let you take it.

73.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
73.text: Dearest Lae'zel. You've fallen victim to a manipulation. The traitor prince would lead us to ruin.

78.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
78.text: Your story ends here. We will reclaim the Astral Prism and restore it to our queen.

43.speaker: Player
43.text: You cannot best me. You will die here, and your legacy will die with you.

25.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
25.text: The traitor prince will be the fall of the githyanki.

129.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
129.text: Vlaakith will not have your head today. But have it, she will.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.

115.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
115.text: Lae'zel. Glad you could join us.

82.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
82.text: The kith'raki have spread word of that artefact that you carry.

140.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
140.text: Lae'zel. So you decided to make your appearance.

63.speaker: Ch'r'ai Har'rak
63.text: It seems your report was good, W'wargaz.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Stand down! It is on our Queen's sacred order that I keep the Prism close.

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Stand down - I protect the Prism on our queen's behalf!

50.speaker: Player
50.text: This artefact contains the key to our freedom. It is not for the lich queen to take!

109.speaker: Player
109.text: The queen has entrusted me with the Prism. Interfere, and death will be her only gift to you.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: Strike me and die - a failed warrior forgotten by our people.

143.speaker: Player
143.text: Orpheus lives. The empire will be his.
